text: Arguable. Cave shmups and Touhou have very distinct gameplay styles from each other. Personally, I very much like them both and find it difficult to choose a favorite. Aesthetically and musically however, I very much prefer Cave though. Manabu Namiki is amazing.

author: Smuggy Misato

text:
@Smuggy Misato Random//RNG reflex patterns >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> static memo patterns, which is why Touhou > Cave IMO. TBH I really wanted Cave games to be my favorite shooters, but there's like 2 reflex patterns in each game, tops.

My personal ranking would be more like Touhou > Ketsui > Dodonpachi > Mushi

text: I just noticed something. Dude, where on earth did you get the idea that this track was composed by Miho Nakamura? She isn't even a composer. She is the voice of Larsa. This song was composed by Manabu Namiki.

text: With how popular Touhou has gotten over the past few years, most of their songs don't need anymore shout-outs than they already received. There are way too many great Touhou songs to mention, and sometimes it's risky stepping into the world of Gesenkyo. At least that's what I think.
author: Madman Asa

text: Guess what?  This game's for the Xbox 360 and wasn't released in the US...BUT  this particular game has no region protection so you can buy it import and play it on your US Xbox 360!  And the Black Label God Mode DLC pack is even available for it!  ^_^  I own it myself and it's the best bullet hell shooter (and the hardest) that I've ever played.

text:
One of many bullet hell shooters from Cave. I've heard this is a very good one.

Anyone else starting to really anticipate E3? I love seeing a new batch of games being announced and I'm especially curious to see new 3DS games.
